Programming

My languages

  • C - My first language. I actually came into the college thinking that I was going to major in mathematics. One of the requirements was programming, and after my first semester, I was hooked. I switched over to computer science, and began this wonderful journey.
  • C++ - The big brother. This was what I learned sorting algorithms on and wrote projects implementing them.
  • Java - Used with intoduction to software engineering, where our team had to develop a large scale piece of software to manage "Chocaholics Anonymous", a sort of health insurance company for chocolate addicts, as our term project.
  • Ruby - What I've used for web development, specifically Rails with server integration. It is what this site has been built on.
  • Javascript - Multiple forms, but mostly jQuery.
  • TSQL - Used when writing stored procedures to automate data collection and relation with Microsoft SQL server.
  • PLC Ladder Logic - Experience mainly with Allen-Bradley PLCs and their associated software, such as RSLogix 5000, RSLinx, etc.

I would include the Microsoft Office Suite (including Visio) but they aren't really programming languages.
